title: Calories in a Stick of Butter
meta_description: Discover calories in stick of butter, including full nutrition breakdown like fat, sodium, and cholesterol, plus tweaks and FAQs for better understanding.
h1: Calories in a Stick of Butter
assumptions: Standard US stick (113 g or 1/2 cup), unsalted, made from cow's milk.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, salting, and processing; always check product labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One stick of unsalted butter contains about 810 kcal, mostly from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 kcal for a standard 113 g unsalted stick.

faqs.q: Is butter high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, one stick has about 58 g of saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does salted butter have more calories?
faqs.a: No, calories remain ~810 kcal; only sodium increases to ~731 mg.

faqs.q: What about carbs in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Butter has virtually 0 g carbs, fiber, or sugars.

faqs.q: How does butter compare to margarine calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar at ~810 kcal per stick, but margarine often has less saturated fat and cholesterol.
